title: The Power of Habit Stacking (效率)
english: Building new, positive habits can often feel like a difficult uphill battle. **Habit stacking** is a simple strategy that makes this process much easier by attaching a new habit to an existing one.
The formula is: 'After I [CURRENT HABIT], I will [NEW HABIT].' For instance, if you already have a consistent morning habit of brewing coffee, you can stack a new habit on top of it.
A few examples: 'After I brush my teeth, I will do ten squats.' or 'After I sit down at my desk, I will write down the three most important tasks for the day.'

This technique leverages the established routine in your brain. Instead of forcing yourself to remember or start a completely new behavior, you are simply connecting it to a behavior you already perform automatically. This small change makes the new habit feel effortless and automatic over time.
chinese: 建立新的、积极的习惯往往感觉像是一场艰难的爬坡战。**习惯叠加法**是一种简单的策略，通过将新习惯附加到现有习惯上来使这个过程变得容易得多。
公式是：“在我 [现有习惯] 之后，我将 [新习惯]。”例如，如果你已经有一个固定的早上冲泡咖啡的习惯，你就可以在其之上叠加一个新习惯。
一些例子：“在我刷牙后，我将做十个深蹲。”或者“在我坐在办公桌前，我将写下今天最重要的三项任务。”
这项技术利用了你大脑中已建立的例行程序。你不是强迫自己记住或开始一个全新的行为，而只是将其连接到一个你已经自动执行的行为上。随着时间的推移，这种小小的改变会使新习惯感觉毫不费力且自动化。

vocabulary.meaning: n. 艰苦的奋斗，艰难的挑战
